;One might hear that a completed log home costs will run 2 or 3 times the price of the log package. This is not an accurate way to judge the cost of your finished log home. For instance, one package may sell for $30, 000 and another of $60, 000, nevertheless less expensive package may well have fewer materials appointed. Thus you have a range of $90, 000 to 180, 000 for a completed home which are both the same size. Components that go into a log home (or any home for example) can vary greatly in price from the low end to your high end. Which end of the building spectrum that you plan to build will make a big difference in the final cost of the home.

;A basic consideration of home cost is what part of the United States are you planning to build.
;
;There are a great disparity in building costs between these various instances of the country. Costs may be higher in California than in Arkansas because of the fact that living costs may be higher in California as compared to in Arkansas.
;
;In some states, there will be greater requirements of the builder and more approvals with various state and local agencies before a permit may be granted to build the home.
;
;Some states should not have building codes or stiff building code requirements or with regard to engineering and contractor licensing and thus costs will end up lower.
;
;Building materials can also be higher in some states and in some areas of individual states as compared to in another location. Thus, where you plan to build is a major consideration when the cost of a log home is analyzed.
;
;Other considerations are:
;
;The type of log home you intend to build. Will it be a precut package, a custom hand-crafted log home or random length logs from a local sawmill. The price of these various components can vary greatly and thus this is the major variable in the cost of building a sign home.
;
;Do you intend to ship logs in from another part of the country to help you get the home and the home plan that you like. Shipping can result in extra costs, but should not be prohibitive when one considers the total cost on the town.
;
;Do you plan to have a comprehensive basement, maybe completely finished, or are you going to build on a slab or crawl space.
